zoSystemTimer.h : Watchdog and timing functionality.
[Avr Hardware Drivers]

Functions

void zoSystemTimerInit (void)
 Initializes the system timer. The watchdog 128KHz oscillator is used.
void zoSystemTimerWatchDogInit (const u16 timeOutMiliSecond)
 Initializes the watchdog timeout period. Since the zoSystemTimerWatchDogEnable() function has been called the watchdog must be serviced every timeOutMiliSecond by using the zoSystemTimerWatchDogReset() function.Otherwise the watchdog will cause a reset of the MCU.
void zoSystemTimerWatchDogEnable (void)
 Enables the watchdog. Call this function if you want to enable the watchdog timer to cause an MCU reset.
void zoSystemTimerWatchDogDisable (void)
 Disables the watchdog.
void zoSystemTimerWatchDogReset (void)
 Services (ie resets) the watchdog.
void zoSystemTimerTimeOutInit (u16 *counter)
 Initializes the timeout functionality. The counter variable is used to keep track of time.
bool zoSystemTimerTimeOutExpired (u16 *counter, const u16 timeOutMiliSecond)
 Checks whether timeOutMilisecond amount of time has passed since initializing the timeout with the zoSystemTimerTimeOutInit() function.
void zoSystemTimerMeasureStart (u16 *counter)
 Initializes the time measurement functionality.
u16 zoSystemTimerMeasureGet (u16 *counter)
 Measures time since initialization.

Detailed Description

Overview
The zoSystemTimer library uses the watchdog timer to provide easy watchdog functionality, but also to provide a global system timer (with a resolution of 16ms) which is used for implementing time measuring routines.
Watchdog functionality example 
 #include "zoTypes.h"
 #include "zoSystemTimer.h"

 int main(void)
 {
     zoSystemTimerInit();                //initializes the watchdog and related ISR
     zoSystemTimerWatchDogInit(100);     //configure the watchdog to cause an MCU reset
                                         //if it is not serviced every 100 ms.                                
     zoSystemTimerWatchDogEnable();      //enable the watchdog

     while(1)
     {
         zoSystemTimerWatchDogReset();   //service the watchdog. If for some reason 
                                         //(ie MCU crash) this command is not executed
                                         //the watchdog will time out and cause a reset
     }

 }
Timeout functionality example
 #include "zoTypes.h"
 #include "zoSystemTimer.h"

 int main(void)
 {
     u16 t;                                      //variable used for timing
     zoSystemTimerInit();                        //initialize the system timer

     zoSystemTimerTimeOutInit(&t);               //initialize t for time measurement
     while( waitForSomethingtoHappen() )         //if MCU waitsForSomethingToHappen
     {                                           //for more than 500ms, the timer t
         if(zoSystemTimerTimeOutExpired(&t,500)) //will timeout and break the loop.
             break;
     }
 }
Todo:
Provide a function handler for an user function just before watchdog reset.

Function Documentation

void zoSystemTimerWatchDogInit ( const u16  timeOutMiliSecond  )  [inline]

Initializes the watchdog timeout period. Since the zoSystemTimerWatchDogEnable() function has been called the watchdog must be serviced every timeOutMiliSecond by using the zoSystemTimerWatchDogReset() function.Otherwise the watchdog will cause a reset of the MCU.

Parameters:
timeOutMiliSecond The time for servicing the watchdog in miliseconds
void zoSystemTimerTimeOutInit ( u16 *  counter  )  [inline]

Initializes the timeout functionality. The counter variable is used to keep track of time.

Parameters:
*counter A local or global variable used for timing.
bool zoSystemTimerTimeOutExpired ( u16 *  counter,
const u16  timeOutMiliSecond 
) [inline]

Checks whether timeOutMilisecond amount of time has passed since initializing the timeout with the zoSystemTimerTimeOutInit() function.

Parameters:
*counter A local or global variable used for timing. This must be the same variable used to initialize the timeout.
timeOutMiliSecond Time in miliseconds for the timeout to expire.
Returns:
True if the elapsed time since initialization is more than timeOutMiliSecond
void zoSystemTimerMeasureStart ( u16 *  counter  )  [inline]

Initializes the time measurement functionality.

Parameters:
*counter A local or global variable used for timing.
u16 zoSystemTimerMeasureGet ( u16 *  counter  ) 

Measures time since initialization.

Parameters:
*counter A local or global variable used for timing.
Returns:
The elapsed time in miliseconds since calling the zoSystemTimerMeasureStart() function.
